name: The Cubicle.
description: The Cubicle is a short VR experience about your regular everyday job in an office, or is it?
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1, or Windows 10 Processor: Intel® i5-4590 / AMD FX 8350 equivalent or greater Memory: 4 MB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce® GTX 970 Ti / AMD Radeon™ R9 290 equivalent or greater Storage: 240 MB available space Additional Notes: Recommended play area is 2.6 x 2.6 but smaller is also possible.

reviews.review_text: Holly crap I was not expecting that!  Btw don't watch the trailer (spoilers)

Is indeed a good experiencie, but I just couldn't end it because my PC for some reason struggled to get a decent framerate in the middle of the experience. I have a core i5 6600 with an 1060 GTX and 32 GB RAM. Maybe it needs some optimization.   Anyway, this is recommended :)
Awesome. Thought I was going to die
Great short VR experience, quite creepy and very interesting only takes about 15 mins so well worth a play

This is a short VR experience -- not a game -- that takes you a Jungian journey in the inner mind using the folder as a metaphor for... uh... something.   No, look, it is a short experience that is sort of interesting, if a little bit frustrating. There are times when it is patiently wating for you to trigger the next event, and it isn't always clear what the trigger might be. In the meantime, you would do well to pay attention to the world around you. You are almost guaranteed to miss out on a few details the first time.  In the end, you get something a little bit like a shorter, more limited, narratorless Stanley Parable. So, you can see there's some art to it, but then again, Stanley Parable with a narrator would be pretty empty.  That's what you get out of this experience: Empty.

Absolutely a great VR experience! I just finished playing it and it is crazy! Excellent job.   It is clearly for people who are looking for a more subtle, narrative kind of experience. But it manages to pull of a kind of intimiate, one-man-show theatrical experience. It's really effective. Can't wait to show it to my friends.
Why do drugs when you can just put on a vive and play this game? This was a very unique experience that I think everyone should try, its free so why not?

This was a fun little game for me and I recommend it for all VR fans. Things start off simple but soon start getting a little strange. You can really feel motion in VR and I almost fell on my butt lol.

Good experience, not a real game though. I could not enjoy the whole simulation, had some serious glitches at some points. (Almost all the games I tried run smoothly) They were so intense I had to take off the HMD :( Missing some background or story content.  Hope there will be an update.
Immersive and realistic office worker simulator.  Just keep sorting files, man. Ignore what's going on around!
Trippy, free, good visuals, short
Very cool, short demo. You should definietly try it. Should be great to show to some friends as well, especially because one playthrough is very short!
love it   but no HTC Vive :(
Great.
Is that it?  I feel like I paid too much. And it was free.
You can look around but can't do anything else. There's also a machine that keeps spitting out folders
Scared the crap out of me! Although I'm a wimp. Its about 5 minutes long but I loved it.
Interesting and worth a look.
I didn't expect much from this game but it surprized me. Awesome little experience.
Very well made. Like most content right now for the vive, just a little something to get you excited about the future of VR. Just download, nothing to lose.
Great and very trippy but small warning - some movement that is not initiated by yourself, which means some unease for those of us with difficulty with that type of thing.
If you think this cubical is boring then you're in for a surprise.. prepare to see 'mundane' turn into a 'WTF' moment..
Just play it, any review is a spoiler.

Without spoiling anything, this is just a short 'cartoon' for VR. It's really nothing special, but for people who can't afford games after dropping all that money for VR, it's worth playing. This is the first experience that I tried with motion, and it was an interesting moment for me, as I felt like I was going to move without actually moving.

This is a nice quick game with an odd sense of humor on the daily grind. I found myself laughing at some parts, and becomming a bit woosy at others. Just keep telling yourself that it's all on your head.
Great free demo to show off what VR can do. Best to go into it knowing nothing about it! Play time was less than 10 mins but it's free and was a nice little experience
Prone to motion sickness. Not at all in this game. Totally incredible experience... Like expriencing a nightmare awaken.
Very good for a first experience in VR!
Nice little experience. Short but sweet.
This was weird, but in a good way. I loved how the game gave me the sensation of being moved, like in a lift. More please.
The most intense filing simulator you will ever try for free, definitley worth a look if you have a Vive
Greate experience, although it's short, I still played it several times just to see details Id missed the first time.
The title and description of this game really don't bring in the attention it deserves. The Cubicle is deceptively simple, but it does so many things right!
Great Experience. Short. It is somewhat of a cross between The Stanley Parable and an experimental film. Just a heads up, it may make you feel a little unsteady.
Great experience, (minor spoilers) this game made my floor feel like it was an elevator. Amazing get it now.
This is the best VR demo. Can't wait to see what the developers make for a real game some day.
A quick and simple experience that gets real weird. I love it.
Nice, but the movment, the sliding to the end is killing all fun for me. So much motion sickness.
